description:
Lipsitz Green Scime Cambria LLP is one of the largest and most respected law firms in upstate New York. The firm enjoys a rich history of success in the form of million-dollar verdicts and settlements. The legal team of nearly 50 attorneys — named Top Listed in Buffalo, New York, for Plaintiff’s Personal Injury Litigation by Best Lawyers in America — is committed to securing the best possible results for Buffalo area residents.

Accidents caused by negligence are life-changing events in the lives of the firm's clients. Every aspect of their lives is affected, both professionally and personally and physically and emotionally. Many victims can no longer work or enjoy a once-active life. Chaos reigns when medical, legal and insurance issues affect the recovery process.

Specific areas of the personal injury practice at Lipsitz Green Scime Cambria LLP include:

  • Car Accidents
  • Construction Accidents
  • Dog Bite and Animal Attacks
  • Farm Accidents
  • Injury on Property
  • Medical Malpractice
  • Mesothelioma and Asbestos
  • Motor Vehicle Accidents
  • Motorcycle Accidents
  • Product Liability
  • Tourist Accidents
  • Workplace Accidents

Few firms can match the attorneys' work ethic, integrity and national recognition. The clients who have retained Lipsitz Green Scime Cambria LLP know that they have a trusted legal advocate who will provide personalized representation and customized strategies. They have provided not only continuing business, but also a strong referral base of friends and families.

Additional areas of the firm's legal practice include:

  • Business and Corporate Law
  • Business Litigation
  • Criminal Defense Trials and Appeals
  • Estates, Wills, and Trusts
  • Labor and Employment Law
  • Matrimonial Law
  • Professional Licensing Defense
  • Real Estate
  • Social Security Disability
  • Workers' Compensation

Lipsitz Green Scime Cambria LLP offers a free initial consultation. The attorneys make themselves available 24 hours a day, seven days a week. All personal injury claims are handled on a contingency basis, meaning that you will not be charged unless the firm wins your case.
